article: A boy selling magazines walked up to a house people seldom visited. The house was old and the owner _ came out. When he did come out he wouldn't say hello to anybody _ simply stared at them. The boy knocked on the door and _ . As he was ready to _ away, the door slowly opened. "What do you want?" the old man said. "Uh, sir, I'm selling these magazines and I was _ if you'd like to buy one." The old man _ stared at the boy. The boy could see the inside of the house and _ some dog figurines . "Do you _ dogs?" the boy asked. "Yes, I do. They're my family here and they're all I have." The boy felt sorry for the man, as he seemed to be very _ . "I've a magazine here for collectors. It's perfect for you. I also have one about dogs since you like dogs so much." But the old man said, "I need _ of the magazines, now goodbye." The boy was sad. He went home and then an idea _ to him. He had a little dog figurine. He walked back to the old man's house with the _ . He knocked on the door again and this time the old man came right to the door. "Boy, I _ I told you no magazines." "No, sir. I know that. I wanted to bring you a _ . " The boy handed him the figurine and the old man's face turned up . "It's a Golden Retriever. I have one at home. This one is _ you." The old man was _ ; no one had ever shown him so much _ . "Boy, you have a kind _ . Thank you!" From that day on the old man _ coming out of the house and talking with people.
